Key Match Events: David Brooks scored the opening goal in the 3rd minute
Neco Williams scored the second goal in the 38th minute
Brennan Johnson restored the two-goal cushion in the 47th minute
Daniel James scored the fourth goal in the 86th minute
Post-Match Reflections: Rob Page, Wales manager: 'It could have been five or six. It goes to show how far we've come, but the message is: it's half time. We have a massive effort to go again on Tuesday, we can't wait.'

Rob Page, Wales manager: 'Dan James was fantastic, on his 50th cap, he got the goal he deserved. It goes to show the confidence he's got. We've got players coming off the bench full of confidence... you can really see it in the performance.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wales will play Poland, who beat a 10-man Estonia 5-1, at the same Cardiff stadium on Tuesday for a place in the June and July finals in Germany.
Others: Finland, who lost their last away game against Wales 3-1 in November 2020, had hoped to qualify for their second major tournament after Euro 2020.
